snippet: The I.R.S. wants to recover $2 billion from Sam Wyly and more than $1.2 billion from the estate of his late brother, Charles Wyly.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service will seek some $3.2 billion in back taxes from prominent Texas businessman Sam Wyly, and from the estate of his brother, Charles; allege that brothers hid income by setting up overseas trust funds.
lead_paragraph: The I.R.S. wants to recover $2 billion from Sam Wyly and more than $1.2 billion from the estate of his late brother, Charles Wyly.

headline.main: I.R.S. Seeks $3.2. Billion in Dispute Over Back Taxes
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Seeks $3.2. Billion in Dispute Over Back Taxes
